headline: Justin Trudeau in self-isolation after wife Sophie tests positive for coronavirus
trailText: Sophie Grégoire Trudeau became ill after a trip to the UK. Canada’s prime minister is currently showing no symptoms

headline: Fears grow Sophie Grégoire Trudeau picked up coronavirus on London trip
trailText: Wife of Canadian PM met Lewis Hamilton, Leona Lewis, Julia Gillard and Idris Elba in UK

headline: Justin Trudeau announces sweeping steps to tackle coronavirus in Canada
trailText: Prime minister delivers address from self-imposed quarantine shuttering parliament and advising curbs on international travel

headline: Queen in Windsor coronavirus move amid fears over Harry
trailText: Duke and Duchess of Sussex take ‘measures’ as monarch cancels garden parties

headline: Trump announces US-Canada border closed to 'non-essential traffic'
trailText: Senate passes new measures while president condemned for again using the phrase ‘Chinese virus’ to refer to Covid-19

headline: Justin Trudeau issues stern warning to Canadians: 'Go home and stay home'
trailText: Prime minister left open possibility of more extreme coronavirus measures after images circulated of people outdoors

headline: Trudeau warns Canada's coronavirus shutdown likely to remain for weeks
trailText: Prime minister said ‘we’re going to have to remain vigilant’ until vaccine is found as infections climb across the country

headline: Nova Scotia shooting  death toll rises as Trudeau calls on Canadians to stand united
trailText: Death toll from country’s deadliest mass shooting rose to 19, including the gunman

headline: Nova Scotia shooting: friends and family pay tribute to ‘beautiful souls’ lost in rampage
trailText: Eighteen people were murdered in a handful of tightly knit communities in the hours-long shooting spree

headline: Trudeau urges caution as Quebec plans to ease lockdown: ‘We’re not out of the woods yet’
trailText: Hardest-hit region in Canada with over 1,600 deaths plans to reopen elementary schools and childcare facilities on 11 May

headline: Trudeau announces Canada is banning assault-style weapons
trailText: Move comes after murder of 22 people in worst mass shooting in Canada’s history

headline: The suspicious case of well-coiffed hair
trailText: Brief letters: Politicians’ hair | Covid-19 testing | Prophylactics | John Cruickshank VC | Making plant feed in tights

headline: A US passport used to be an asset. Under Trump it has become a liability
trailText: The president has stopped pretending to do anything about coronavirus. Travellers from the US are about to become the pariahs of the world

headline: Trudeau: Canadians watching US unrest and police violence in ‘shock and horror’
trailText: Prime minister condemned racism and called on Canada to ‘stand together in solidarity’ against racial hate as protests continue in US

headline: Justin Trudeau takes a knee but is silent on reforms to policing
trailText: Canadian PM attends Ottawa rally but would not be drawn on policies to tackle racism

headline: Canada’s failed UN security council bid exposes Trudeau’s 'dilettante' foreign policy
trailText: Second failed attempt to win seat raises questions about messaging and clarity in Canada’s foreign policy, experts say

headline: Canada risks being outplayed in feud over citizens jailed in China
trailText: Ottawa’s refusal to swap Huawei’s Meng Wanzhou for detainees Michael Kovrig and Michael Spavor means it faces some hard choices

headline: Armed man roamed Justin Trudeau's grounds for 13 minutes after ramming gates
trailText: Canadian police confirm man had ‘several’ weapons and will face multiple charges

headline: Justin Trudeau snubs Nafta meeting with Trump in Washington
trailText: Mexico’s president to meet Trump on Wednesday but Canada PM had spoken of concern about US tariffs on metals last week

headline: 'It's like night and day': Trudeau's and Trump's Covid-19 responses fuel wildly different outcomes
trailText: The US president stokes division as the virus rages, while the prime minister of Canada – where the outbreak appears to be stabilizing – has fostered a shared sense of duty

headline: Justin Trudeau faces calls for criminal investigation into family's charity links
trailText: WE Charity, which was awarded multimillion-dollar government contract, paid PM’s mother and wife for appearances at events

headline: UK marks 75th anniversary of Victory over Japan Day
trailText: VJ Day was declared when emperor Hiroito ordered his people to stop fighting in second world war

headline: Canada finance minister resigns amid charity scandal and reports of tensions with Trudeau
trailText: Opposition parties have called for Bill Morneau’s resignation over allegations he had a conflict of interest

headline: Canada: departure of finance minister suggests Trudeau will pursue ‘green’ recovery plan
trailText: The prime minister has an ambitious post-pandemic plan that would go against the wishes of powerful industries – and several provincial leaders

headline: Trudeau accused of attempting to cover up scandal by proroguing parliament
trailText: Move to ‘reset’ government due to coronavirus comes amid committee investigations into WE charity affair

headline: WE Charity closes Canada operations after scandal linked to Trudeau family
trailText: Brothers who founded influential organisation will also stand down, blaming Covid and damage to its brand

headline: Trudeau bets on strength of his Covid response in gamble to stay in power
trailText: Canadian PM hopes his handling of the crisis can override uproar over ethics inquiries and his prorogation of parliament

headline: Trudeau pledges tax on 'extreme wealth inequality' to fund Covid spending plan
trailText: PM says government will invest billions in housing, health and jobs, but dismissals from rival parties prompt election speculation

headline: A Trump win or a disputed result are Canadians' worst fears
trailText: Whatever happens on 3 November spells difficulty for Justin Trudeau as trade conflicts with the US are unlikely to go away even with a Biden victory

headline: Justin Trudeau offers blunt assessment of global pandemic: ‘It really sucks’
trailText: PM’s message a stark contrast to dismissive or overly optimistic tone set by some other world leaders, such as Donald Trump

headline: Brexit talks making good progress, says Ursula Von der Leyen
trailText: European commission president says key issues are level playing field and fisheries

headline: US allies welcome Biden presidency as major chance to tackle climate crisis
trailText: Macron and Johnson put climate at top of issues to confront together, as experts say window is still open to fulfil goals of Paris deal

headline: Trudeau: UK's lack of negotiating practice could delay Canada trade deal
trailText: Britain may lack ‘bandwidth to move forward’ as Brexit transition nears end, say PM

headline: UK and Canada to trade on EU terms after Brexit transition
trailText: Conservative government says agreement paves the way for new bespoke deal with Canada

headline: 'Leave Nato': Justin Trudeau pranked by Russian duo posing as Greta Thunberg
trailText: Vovan and Lexus strike again, urging Canadian prime minister to introduce them to South Park characters Terrance and Phillip

headline: India summons Canada envoy as row deepens over Trudeau's protest remarks
trailText: Officials condemn ‘unacceptable interference’ from Canadian PM, who called clashes between police and farmers ‘concerning’

headline: The Guardian view on online child abuse: this horror must be faced
trailText: Editorial: New revelations about Pornhub should prompt immediate action. For leaders to voice ‘concern’, while doing nothing, is shameful

headline: Canada’s governor general resigns after report finds workplace harassment
trailText: Anonymous staff members say they were berated by Julie Payette to the point of tears, prompting an independent investigation

headline: 'We're double-dipping': Trudeau pressured to speed vaccine distribution amid Covax backlash
trailText: Government faces accusations it is taking Covid-fighting supplies intended for developing countries

headline: Majority of Canadians think royal family 'no longer relevant'
trailText: Tumultuous exit of Canada’s governor general prompts questioning of role and monarchy

headline: Chinese diplomat accuses Trudeau of making Canada 'running dog of US'
trailText: Clash is latest between China and Canada in recent months over Beijing’s treatment of its Uighur minority

headline: ‘Let this send a clear message’: world leaders react to Derek Chauvin verdict
trailText: Justin Trudeau welcomes jurors’ decisicion but warns that systemic racism still exists in the US
